name: Debian 12 (Bookworm)
install_guide_markdown: 1. Download the netinst or DVD image. 2. Verify SHA256. 3. Write to USB with balenaEtcher or dd. 4. Boot and follow the installer (guided partitioning recommended).

install_steps.title: Download the installer
install_steps.detail_md: Grab the netinst (minimal) or DVD image from the official CDN to ensure trusted mirrors.

install_steps.title: Write ISO to USB
install_steps.detail_md: Use balenaEtcher, Rufus (DD mode), or `sudo dd if=... of=/dev/sdX bs=4M status=progress`.

commands.command: sudo dd if=debian-12.8.0-amd64-netinst.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M status=progress && sync
commands.explanation: Write with dd (replace sdX with your USB device)

install_steps.title: Run installer
install_steps.detail_md: Boot the USB, pick guided partitioning, and select GNOME or your preferred desktop task.

install_steps.title: Update and enable non-free firmware
install_steps.detail_md: Run `sudo apt update && sudo apt full-upgrade` and enable `non-free-firmware` in sources if needed for Wi-Fi/GPUs.

commands.command: sudo apt update && sudo apt full-upgrade
commands.explanation: Bring system fully up to date

privacy_notes: Debian ships with telemetry disabled by default; popularity-contest is opt-in.
notes: Great for stable servers and predictable desktops. Non-free firmware may be required for some Wi-Fi chipsets.
